body:
The Dawn & The Dusk: 2 sessions, 2 different ways to play.

This is a new rotation update to have the MCZone rots split into 2 different sections of time rather than opening a new server: There's Dawn, and there's Dusk. What do these two terms mean when it comes to playing on the server?

Dawn: Plays maps strictly from the MCZone era.
Dusk: Plays maps strictly from early avicus, early avicore, and an extra Quintus + Clay Wars.

I didn't want to separate everyone into different servers since it has the prime purpose of catering to nostalgia and the fact of the matter is that there's already too many nebula servers unvacant, and with this session update I hope that there's some more action packed onto what some of you requested. There's a list of maps for Dusk, and they follow below (though some missing):



The maps that may be added are CherrylandMC, Haze, Broken World, & Abandoned Park I. This is a very early stage development, so if there could be any further changes to the nostalgic rotations you can post feedback below.

Thanks!

title: The Dawn & The Dusk: Rot Update

replies.body: One big rotation, one time plays MCZone maps while another plays old avicus maps. Think of 2 rots into 1 server.
replies.body_tagged: One big rotation, one time plays MCZone maps while another plays old avicus maps. Think of 2 rots into 1 server.

reply_to.body: One big rotation, one time plays MCZone maps while another plays old avicus maps. Think of 2 rots into 1 server.
reply_to.body_tagged: One big rotation, one time plays MCZone maps while another plays old avicus maps. Think of 2 rots into 1 server.

replies.body:
https://github.com/Avicus/Rotations/blob/master/servers/MCZone01.yml
Think of it like this:
It goes through the normal MCZone rots in the early part of the rots (hence the "dawn")
Later, near the end of the rots it plays the Avicore/Early avicus rots (hence "dusk")

So, MCZone came first, it comes first in the rots. Early avicus/Avicore came second, so it's second/last in the rots
replies.body_tagged:
